result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James R. Sikora

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for James R. Sikora
Current: 934 S 18th Ave, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 10-24-2016)
Prior: 500 Forest Street, c/o Marathon Co Jail, Wausau, WI 54403

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:41 am 
INCLUDES 15CF67, 15CF142, AND 13CF223. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Dana Norgard. 

WAIVER OF PRELIM IN 15CF67. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions def as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information filed. 

PLEA HEARING IN 15CF67 AND 15CF142. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 
State moves to: 
In 15CF67: Ct. 1 (Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF142: Ct. 1 (Knowingly Violate a DA Order - Injunction)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Knowingly Violate a DA Order - Injunction)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Knowingly Violate a DA Order - Injunction)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Knowingly Violate a DA Order - Injunction)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 5 (Knowingly Violate a DA Order - Injunction)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 
PLEA: 
In 15CF67: Ct. 2 (Misd. Battery/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                 : Ct. 3 (False Imprisonment/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                 : Ct. 4 (DC/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
State makes statement. Atty Norgard makes statement. Def makes statement. 
COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 20 (twenty) hours CS per week; no contact with T.J.L, K.R.L, or L.R.L unless authorized by agent; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 334 days jail credit if revoked. 

SENTENCING ON REVOCATION IN 13CF223. 
VRCW. 
COURT ORDERS: On Ct. 1>>1 year MCJ with 338 days jail credit; payment of any unpaid court costs w/ 60 days to pay or payment plan.  

Adj: 11:02 am
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

ADDRESS INFO for James R. Sikora
Current: 500 Forest Street, c/o Marathon Co Jail, Wausau, WI 54403   (Effective: 02-16-2015)
Prior: 500 Forest Street, Wausau, WI 54403
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
for records from DA's office with copy of SPD appointment and Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection - includes 15CF67 & 15CF142
Pre-trial conference on July 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Case Called: 10:19 am
Clerk:  Kim H.
15CF67 and 15CF142
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig. Deft appears in custody and with Atty Jay Kronenwetter.  Date and time set for Preliminary Hearing.  State moves to dismiss felony charge in 15CF142.  Atty Kronenwetter has no objection.  COURT allows amended criminal complaint be filed.  Atty Kronenwetter waives reading, and enters plea of not guilty to all counts.  COURT questions factual basis.  ADA Puig states factual basis is in original complaint.  COURT addresses 15CF67.  Atty Kronenwetter moves to withdraw as counsel in both cases.  TL not an issue.   Defendant does not object.  COURT GRANTS motion to withdraw.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's office for counsel.   Atty Kronenwetter states he will assist.  COURT sets CC 5/6/15 at 1:00 pm.
C: Br. 3
Adj:   10:22 am
Preliminary Hearing on April 28, 2015 at 10:15 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s): L.L. (non waivable). Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
